alert.note: Alert for Portage; Waupaca; Waushara; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 02 at 2:24PM CDT until September 03 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Extreme fire weather conditions possible for Sunday afternoon into early Sunday evening across central Wisconsin... .The ongoing drought, combined with record to near-record high temperatures, strong southwest wind gusts in the 20 mph range and low humidity values may result in extreme fire weather conditions across portions of central Wisconsin for Sunday afternoon into Sunday evening. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR FOR EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS OVER CENTRAL WISCONSIN... The National Weather Service in Green Bay has issued a Fire Weather Watch for extreme fire weather conditions, which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through Sunday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Wood, Portage, Waupaca and Waushara. * TIMING...From Sunday afternoon through Sunday evening. * WINDS...Southwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 24 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the upper 90s. * IMPACTS...Fires will start easily and spread quickly in these conditions. So outdoor burning should not be attempted.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions may occur. A combination of strong winds, very low relative humidity, warm temperatures, and exceptionally dry fuels may create dangerous wildland fire conditions. Firefighters, emergency management, and law enforcement should monitor forecasts for updates on this potentially dangerous wildland fire situation. Visit the Wisconsin DNR website at apps.dnr.wi.gov/wisburn/#/BurnRestrictions and click on the appropriate county to view current burning restrictions.
